items.title: 'Matilda, get down': Parents of youngest Bondi terror victim speak out
items.description: The parents of 10-year-old Matilda, the youngest victim of the Bondi terror attack, recall the final moments leading up to shooting, paying tribute to the woman who saved their younger daughter.

items.title: Live: Parliament returns to pay tribute to victims of Bondi terror attack
items.description: Parliament has returned ahead of schedule to honour the victims of the Bondi terror attack. Follow live.

items.title: AI is an ethical, social and economic nightmare — and we're starting to wake up
items.description: As 2025 began, I thought humanity's biggest problem was climate change. In 2026, AI is more pressing.

items.title: Live: Police providing update on boy mauled by 'large shark' at Sydney beach
items.description: The boy was pulled aboard a vessel by water police officers  "within minutes" of the Triple Zero call being made.

items.title: Trump asks Australia, Albanese to join Gaza 'Board of Peace'
items.description: The US president is pushing for the board to preserve a fragile ceasefire between Hamas and Israel and progress the peace deal to the next phase.

items.title: Why Donald Trump could exploit the US's 250th birthday for his own gain
items.description: The United States of America is celebrating the 250th anniversary of its union as a nation and experts say Donald Trump appears to be exploiting the events for his own political gain.

items.title: Life in Cuba is about to get harder as Trump threatens oil supply
items.description: Many experts are predicting life in Cuba is about to get even harder.

items.title: NATO allies warn Trump of 'dangerous downward spiral' over Greenland threats
items.description: The US president says European countries will be hit with tariffs until a deal is struck that would see the Danish territory become an American possession.

items.title: Melbourne goes from among the most to least expensive capital cities
items.description: Property analysts say a mix of economic conditions, policy settings and demographic shifts are among the reasons for the city's subdued dwelling price growth in the past five years.

items.title: ASX-listed company on brink of collapse buries whistleblower complaint
items.description: An investigation into whistleblower allegations finds senior managers at a NSW coal mine were involved in a decision by the mine to award their own companies multi-million-dollar contracts.

items.title: Live: Wall Street flat, ASX on edge ahead of tariff threat fallout
items.description: The ASX is on edge after a renewed escalation on trade tensions between the US and Europe and ahead of key Chinese data. Follow the day's events and insights from our business reporters on the ABC News live markets blog.

items.title: Pentagon could deploy troops to Minnesota protests, US officials say
items.description: The possible deployment comes after US President Donald Trump threatened to invoke the Insurrection Act to quell anti-ICE protests in the state.

items.title: Writers' Week letter shows premier backed removal of Randa Abdel-Fattah
items.description: South Australia's premier told the Adelaide Festival board it would open itself to "accusations of hypocrisy" and "legitimate public ridicule" if it did not cancel the appearance of Randa Abdel-Fattah from Writers' Week.

items.title: Five quick hits: Frustrated fans and an early contender for shot of the tournament
items.description: Fans were left queuing for hours after play started, Alexander Zverev got confused by a gate and Maria Sakkari smashed an insane shot. Here are the quick hits from the Australian Open.

items.title: Body found among wreckage of plane in Indonesia
items.description: A body has been found among the wreckage of an Indonesian plane that lost contact mid-flight.

items.title: Celebrity chef among the new faces at $800m Sydney Fish Market
items.description: It is perhaps the most expensive seafood centre of its kind, but just what can visitors expect from the new $800 million Sydney Fish Market?

items.title: What psychologists have to say about the seven types of rest
items.description: Have you ever found yourself still exhausted and deflated after an eight-hour sleep? Perhaps sleep isn't the reset you need.

items.title: Mother calls for worksite policy after son's death from extreme heat
items.description: It has been 13 years since Jenny Newport's son died from extreme heat while on a worksite in Queensland. She believes not much has changed.

items.title: Nurse tried to steal patient's medication, falsify records, tribunal finds
items.description: A senior public hospital nurse has been prohibited from working for four years for attempting to steal medication from a patient and manipulating a co-worker's Facebook account in an attempt to cover it up.

items.title: Smith amuses and delights, England all-rounder stars as Sixers lock in finals
items.description: Steve Smith oscillates between the ridiculous and the sublime as the Sydney Sixers get the better of the Brisbane Heat in a do-or-die clash at the Gabba.

items.title: How a raging bushfire is mapped in 'near real time'
items.description: As the devastating fires in Victoria spread earlier this month, people at home could see how they were moving across the state — not just in videos on the news and social media, but on an interactive map.

items.title: New mayor says lived experience with disability 'actually a strength'
items.description: A new Victorian mayor is already challenging the way his council thinks about inclusivity.

items.title: Australian company battles illegal trade to crack Chinese seahorse market
items.description: A seahorse farm in Tasmania thought it was onto a sure thing; exporting dried seahorses to the Chinese market — it turned out not to be as easy as hoped.

items.title: Fun and easy recipes kids can help with in the kitchen
items.description: We’ve put together four recipes that are fun and easy enough for kids to help with.

items.title: Great Britain edges Australia to win SailGP event in Perth
items.description: Reigning Sail Grand Prix champions Great Britain make the best possible start to season 2026, taking the win in Fremantle with a strong two-day performance culminating with victory in Sunday's final.
